com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.sort

Interface Sort

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<SortBy>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSort, SortBuilder, SortBy

    public interface Sort
extends Iterable<SortBy>
    Interface for representing IDOL sort expressions. An example expression might be: 
     relevance+MYFIELD:increasing
    The SortBuilder class can be used to combine sort expressions into more complex expressions. However, it is often unnecessary to explicitly instantiate a SortBuilder as the Sort interface forces all specifiers to provide support for combining expressions.

    SortBy provides static fields and methods for working with the most common sort specifiers.

    Example: 

     Sort sort = SortBy.RELEVANCE.then(SortBy.increasing("MYFIELD"));
    This becomes even simpler using static imports: 
     Sort sort = RELEVANCE.then(increasing("MYFIELD"));

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object obj)
      Two Sort objects are considered equal if they have the same toString() representation.
      int hashCode()
      The hashcode should be that of the String representation.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Whether or not the Sort is empty.
      int size()
      The number of sort specifiers in the sort.
      Sort then(Iterable<? extends SortBy>... sorts)
      Builds a complex sort expression where the current sort is used first and the specified sorts are used in the event of a tie.
      String toString()
      The String representation of the sort expression, as it should be sent to IDOL.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • then

        Sort then(Iterable<? extends SortBy>... sorts)
        Builds a complex sort expression where the current sort is used first and the specified sorts are used in the event of a tie. The current object may or may not be modified.
        Parameters:
        sorts - Sorting specifiers to add to the current sort
        Returns:
        The composite sort expression

      • size

        int size()
        The number of sort specifiers in the sort. This should be equal to the number of items in the iterator.
        Returns:
        The current number of specifiers in the sort

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Whether or not the Sort is empty.
        Returns:
        true if and only if size() == 0

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object obj)
        Two Sort objects are considered equal if they have the same toString() representation.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - An object to test for equality
        Returns:
        true if and only if obj is a Sort object with the same toString() value as this object
